info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Webb and southwestern La Salle Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 500 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chaparral Wildlife Management Area, or 14 miles southwest of Cotulla, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Ewell Site, Artesia Wells and Chaparral Wildlife Management Area. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 48 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
